page.title: 03ROOTS OF MODERN BLACKPOOL
page.content: Blackpool as such is the result of the gradual development and merging of a number of small village nuclei during the 19th.and early 20th.centuries.Two of these early settlements,{Little & Great Marton}lie within the survey area on the Northern & Western edges of the former{Marton {Moss.}Much of the mossland has been reclaimed over the years for development as building land or for farming. Little Marton boasts the last remaining {windmill}in Blackpool,a relic of the past when the mosslands were a large grain-growing area.The region was at one time known as{ {'Windmill Land'}.The original area of moss can still be ascertained by examining the main road pattern of the area which avoids any direct traverse.
